- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,

- And Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, monitoring their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,

## Article Two
The expenditure estimates in the budget of the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025 shall be amended to become KD 5,033,101,000 (five billion, thirty-three million, one hundred and one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only), in accordance with Schedule (B) attached to this Decree-Law.

## Article Three
The surplus of revenues over expenditures shall be amended to become KD 1,660,755,000 (one billion, six hundred sixty million, seven hundred fifty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only), to be added to the reserves of the funds stipulated in the aforementioned Social Security Law <orig>قانون التأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>, in accordance with Schedule (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

## Article Four
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers – each within their respective competencies – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Decree-Law No. 106 of 2025
## Approving the Final Account of the State's Financial Administration
## For the Fiscal Year 2025/2024

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Decree-Law No. (106) of 1976 regarding the Future Generations Reserve <orig>احتياطي الأجيال القادمة</orig>, amended by Law No. 18 of 2020,
- And Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, controlling their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
- And Decree-Law No. (8) of 2024 linking the budget of ministries and government departments for the fiscal year 2025/2024
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding ministerial succession and deputization <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the presentation of the Acting Minister of Finance,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

### Article One
The final account of the State's Financial Administration for the fiscal year 2025/2024 is hereby approved as follows:
(a) The revenues of ministries and government departments amounted to 22,057,640,331.

# Decree-Law No. 108 of 2025
## Approving the Final Account of the Public Authority for Youth for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025

*   Having reviewed the Constitution,
*   And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
*   And Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, controlling their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
*   And Law No. (100) of 2015 regarding the establishment of the Public Authority for Youth <orig>الهيئة العامة للشباب</orig>,
*   And Decree-Law No. (19) of 2024 linking the budget of the Public Authority for Youth <orig>الهيئة العامة للشباب</orig> for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025,
*   And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
*   And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Finance,
*   And after the approval of the Council of Ministers,
*   We have issued the following Decree-Law:

(Article One)
The final account of the Public Authority for Youth <orig>الهيئة العامة للشباب</orig> for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025 is hereby approved as follows:
a- Expenditures amounted to K.D. 12,052,342.501 (twelve million, fifty-two thousand, three hundred and forty-two Dinars and five hundred and one Fils only), as stated in Table (A) attached to this Decree-Law.
b- Revenues amounted to K.D. 193,411.072 (one hundred and ninety-three thousand, four hundred and eleven Dinars and seventy-two Fils only), as stated in Table (B) attached to this Decree-Law.
c- The excess of expenditures over revenues amounted to K.D. 11,858,931.429 (eleven million, eight hundred and fifty-eight thousand, nine hundred and thirty-one Dinars and four hundred and twenty-nine Fils only). This excess in expenditures was covered from the budget of Ministries and Government Departments (Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> - Public Accounts) for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025, as stated in Table (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

(Article Two)
The Prime Minister and the Ministers - each within their respective competencies - shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Amir of Kuwait
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

*   Having reviewed the Constitution,
*   And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
*   And Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, controlling their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
*   And Law No. (10) of 2011 regarding the establishment of the General Authority for the Care of Printing and Publishing the Holy Quran, the Sunnah, and Their Sciences <orig>الهيئة العامة للعناية بطباعة ونشر القرآن الكريم والسنة النبوية وعلومهما</orig>,
*   And Decree-Law No. (20) of 2024 linking the budget of the General Authority for the Care of Printing and Publishing the Holy Quran, the Sunnah, and Their Sciences <orig>الهيئة العامة للعناية بطباعة ونشر القرآن الكريم والسنة النبوية وعلومهما</orig> for the Fiscal Year 2025/2024,
*   And Decree-Law No. (3) of 2025 regarding the General Authority for the Care of Printing and Publishing the Holy Quran, the Sunnah, and Their Sciences <orig>الهيئة العامة للعناية بطباعة ونشر القرآن الكريم والسنة النبوية وعلومهما</orig>,
*   And Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
*   And based on the presentation of the Acting Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية بالوكالة</orig>,
*   And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
*   We have issued the following Decree-Law:

### (Article One)
The final account of the General Authority for the Care of Printing and Publishing the Holy Quran, the Sunnah, and Their Sciences <orig>الهيئة العامة للعناية بطباعة ونشر القرآن الكريم والسنة النبوية وعلومهما</orig> for the Fiscal Year 2025/2024 is hereby approved as follows:
a- Expenditures amounted to K.D. 2,934,093.258 (Two million, nine hundred thirty-four thousand, ninety-three Dinars and two hundred fifty-eight Fils only) as stated in Table (A) attached to this Decree-Law.
b- Revenues amounted to K.D. 27,389.967 (Twenty-seven thousand, three hundred eighty-nine Dinars and nine hundred sixty-seven Fils only) as stated in Table (B) attached to this Decree-Law.
c- The excess of expenditures over revenues amounted to K.D. 2,906,703.291 (Two million, nine hundred six thousand, seven hundred three Dinars and two hundred ninety-one Fils only). This excess in expenditures was covered from the budget of Ministries and Government Departments (Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Public Accounts) for the Fiscal Year 2025/2024, as stated in Table (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

### (Article Two)
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers – each within their respective competencies – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Decree-Law No. 116 of 2025
## Approving the Final Account of the Medical Responsibility Authority <orig>جهاز المسؤولية الطبية</orig>
## for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025

*   Having reviewed the Constitution,
*   And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
*   And Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, controlling their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
*   And Law No. (3) of 2003 concerning the procedures for issuing certain annexed and independent budgets and their final accounts, amended by Law No. (8) of 2015,
*   And Law No. (70) of 2020 regarding the practice of medicine and its allied professions, and the rights of patients and health facilities,
*   And Decree-Law No. (28) of 2024 linking the budget of the Medical Responsibility Authority <orig>جهاز المسؤولية الطبية</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025,
*   And Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning ministerial succession and deputization, and its amending decrees,
*   And based on the presentation of the Acting Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية بالوكالة</orig>,
*   And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
*   We have issued the following Decree-Law:

(Article One)
The final account of the Medical Responsibility Authority <orig>جهاز المسؤولية الطبية</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025 is hereby approved as follows:
a- Expenses amounted to K.D. 2,851,784.024 (Two Million, Eight Hundred Fifty-One Thousand, Seven Hundred Eighty-Four Dinars and Twenty-Four Fils only), as detailed in Table (A) attached to this Decree-Law.
b- Revenues amounted to K.D. 139,622.000 (One Hundred Thirty-Nine Thousand, Six Hundred Twenty-Two Dinars only), as detailed in Table (B) attached to this Decree-Law.
c- The excess of expenses over revenues amounted to K.D. 2,712,162.024 (Two Million, Seven Hundred Twelve Thousand, One Hundred Sixty-Two Dinars and Twenty-Four Fils only). This excess in expenses was covered from the budget of Ministries and Government Departments - (Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> - Public Accounts) for the fiscal year 2025/2024, as detailed in Table (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

(Article Two)
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers, each within their respective competencies, shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Decree-Law No. 120 of 2025
## Approving the Final Account of the Public Authority for Disability Affairs / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma li-Shu'un Dhawi Al-I'aqa <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون ذوي الإعاقة</orig>
## for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah <orig>ذو القعدة</orig> 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. (8) of 2010 regarding the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, amended by Law No. 101 of 2015, and Law No. 73 of 2020,
- And Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the Rules for Preparing Public Budgets, Monitoring their Implementation, and the Final Account, and its amending laws,
- And Decree-Law No. (14) of 2024 linking the budget of the Public Authority for Disability Affairs / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma li-Shu'un Dhawi Al-I'aqa <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون ذوي الإعاقة</orig> for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Succession and Appointments, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the presentation of the Acting Minister of Finance,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers / Cabinet <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

### (Article One)
The final account of the Public Authority for Disability Affairs / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma li-Shu'un Dhawi Al-I'aqa <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون ذوي الإعاقة</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025 is hereby approved as follows:
a. Expenditures amounted to KWD 214,262,135.573 (two hundred fourteen million, two hundred sixty-two thousand, one hundred thirty-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and five hundred seventy-three fils only), as stated in Table (A) attached to this Decree-Law.
b. Revenues amounted to KWD 4,413,649.072 (four million, four hundred thirteen thousand, six hundred forty-nine Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and seventy-two fils only), as stated in Table (B) attached to this Decree-Law.
c. The excess of expenditures over revenues amounted to KWD 209,848,486.501 (two hundred nine million, eight hundred forty-eight thousand, four hundred eighty-six Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and five hundred one fils only). This excess in expenditures was covered from the budget of Ministries and Government Departments (Ministry of Finance – Public Accounts) for the fiscal year 2024/2025, as stated in Table (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

### (Article Two)
The Prime Minister and the Ministers – each within their respective competencies – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Amir of Kuwait
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Acting Prime Minister
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Acting Minister of Finance
Dr. Subaih Abdulaziz Abdulhassan Al-Mukhaizim <orig>د. صبيح عبد العزيز عبد الحسن المخيزم</orig>

Issued at Seif Palace / Qasr Al-Seif <orig>قصر السيف</orig> on: 23 Safar <orig>صفر</orig> 1447 AH
Corresponding to: 17 August 2025 AD

c- The increase in expenditures over revenues amounted to **1,965,976.811 K.D.** (One million, nine hundred sixty-five thousand, nine hundred seventy-six Dinars and eight hundred eleven Fils only). The increase in expenditures was covered from the budget of ministries and government departments (Ministry of Finance / Wizarat Al-Maliya <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Public Accounts / Al-Hisabat Al-Amma <orig>الحسابات العامة</orig>) for the fiscal year 2024/2025, as stated in Table (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

(Article Two)
The Prime Minister and the Ministers, each within their respective competencies, shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Decree-Law No. 122 of 2025
## Approving the Final Account of the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig>
## For the Fiscal Year 2024/2025

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, controlling their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (112) of 2013 establishing the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig>, amended by Law No. (16) of 2019,
- And Decree-Law No. (21) of 2024 linking the budget of the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding ministerial succession and deputization, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the proposal of the Acting Minister of Finance,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

### (Article One)
The final account of the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025 is hereby approved as follows:
a- Expenditures amounted to K.D. 247,524,324.23 (twenty-three million, three hundred twenty-four thousand, five hundred twenty-four Dinars and two hundred twenty-seven Fils only) as stated in Table (A) attached to this Decree-Law.
b- Revenues amounted to K.D. 2,591,383.835 (two million, five hundred ninety-one thousand, three hundred eighty-three Dinars and eight hundred thirty-five Fils only) as stated in Table (B) attached to this Decree-Law.
c- The increase in expenditures over revenues amounted to K.D. 20,733,140.412 (twenty million, seven hundred thirty-three thousand, one hundred forty Dinars and four hundred twelve Fils only). This increase in expenditures was covered from the budget of ministries and government departments (Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Public Accounts) for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025, as stated in Table (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

### (Article Two)
The Prime Minister and the Ministers – each within their respective competencies – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

# Decree by Law No. 124 of 2025
## Approving the Final Account of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>
## for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025

– Having reviewed the Constitution,
– And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
– And Decree by Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, controlling their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
– And Law No. (2) of 2016 concerning the establishment of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> and the provisions related to financial disclosure, amended by Decree by Law No. 69 of 2025,
– And Decree by Law No. (24) of 2024 linking the budget of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025,
– And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding ministerial succession and deputization, and its amending decrees,
– And based on the recommendation of the Acting Minister of Finance,
– And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
– We have issued the following Decree by Law:

### (Article One)
The final account of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025 is hereby approved as follows:
a- Expenditures amounted to K.D. 10,387,186.072 (ten million, three hundred eighty-seven thousand, one hundred eighty-six Kuwaiti Dinars and seventy-two fils only) as stated in Table (A) attached to this Decree by Law.
b- Revenues amounted to K.D. 29,202,262.29 (twenty-nine thousand, two hundred two Kuwaiti Dinars and two hundred sixty-two fils only) as stated in Table (B) attached to this Decree by Law.
c- The excess of expenditures over revenues amounted to K.D. 10,357,983.810 (ten million, three hundred fifty-seven thousand, nine hundred eighty-three Kuwaiti Dinars and eight hundred ten fils only). This excess in expenditures was covered from the budget of ministries and government departments (Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Public Accounts) for the fiscal year 2025/2024, as stated in Table (C) attached to this Decree by Law.

### (Article Two)
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree by Law, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Acting Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية بالوكالة</orig>
Dr. Subaih Abdulaziz Abdulmohsen Al-Mukhaizim <orig>صبيح عبد العزيز عبد المحسن المخيزم</orig>

Issued at Seif Palace <orig>قصر السيف</orig> on: 23 Safar 1447 AH
Corresponding to: 17 August 2025 AD

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

# Decree-Law No. 126 of 2025
## Approving the Final Account of the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig>
## for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, controlling their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (3) of 2003 concerning the procedures for issuing certain annexed and independent budgets and their final accounts, amended by Law No. (8) of 2015,
- And Law No. (42) of 2014 regarding the issuance of the Environmental Protection Law, amended by Law No. (99) of 2015,
- And Decree-Law No. (16) of 2024 linking the budget of the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning ministerial succession and deputization, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the presentation of the Acting Minister of Finance,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

(Article One)
The final account of the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025 is hereby approved as follows:
a- Expenditures amounted to K.D. 30,469,258.494 (thirty million, four hundred sixty-nine thousand, two hundred fifty-eight Dinars and four hundred ninety-four Fils only), as stated in Table (A) attached to this Decree-Law.
b- Revenues amounted to K.D. 941,243.903 (nine hundred forty-one thousand, two hundred forty-three Dinars and nine hundred forty-three Fils only), as stated in Table (B) attached to this Decree-Law.
c- The excess of expenditures over revenues amounted to K.D. 29,528,014.591 (twenty-nine million, five hundred twenty-eight thousand, fourteen Dinars and five hundred ninety-one Fils only). This excess in expenditures was covered from the budget of Ministries and Government Departments (Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> - General Accounts) for the fiscal year 2024/2025, as stated in Table (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

(Article Two)
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> - each within his jurisdiction - shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>
Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Acting Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية بالوكالة</orig>
Dr. Subaih Abdulaziz Abdulmohsen Al-Mukhaizim <orig>د. صبيح عبد العزيز عبد المحسن المخيزم</orig>

# Decree by Law No. 127 of 2025
## Approving the Final Account of the Public-Private Partnership Projects Authority <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig> for the Fiscal Year 2025/2024

*   Having reviewed the Constitution,
*   And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
*   And Decree by Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, controlling their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
*   And Law No. (116) of 2014 regarding Public-Private Partnership <orig>الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig>,
*   And Decree by Law No. (29) of 2024 linking the budget of the Public-Private Partnership Projects Authority <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig> for the Fiscal Year 2025/2024,
*   And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
*   Based on the proposal of the Acting Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية بالوكالة</orig>,
*   And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
*   We have issued the following Decree by Law:

### (Article One)
The final account of the Public-Private Partnership Projects Authority <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig> for the Fiscal Year 2025/2024 is hereby approved as follows:
a- Expenditures amounted to K.D. 3,358,086.987 (three million, three hundred and fifty-eight thousand, eighty-six Dinars and nine hundred and eighty-seven Fils only) as per Table (A) attached to this Decree by Law.
b- Revenues amounted to K.D. 103,591.597 (one hundred and three thousand, five hundred and ninety-one Dinars and five hundred and ninety-seven Fils only) as per Table (B) attached to this Decree by Law.
c- The excess of expenditures over revenues amounted to K.D. 3,254,495.390 (three million, two hundred and fifty-four thousand, four hundred and ninety-five Dinars and three hundred and ninety Fils only). This excess in expenditures was covered from the budget of Ministries and Government Departments (Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> - Public Accounts <orig>الحسابات العامة</orig>) for the Fiscal Year 2025/2024, as per Table (C) attached to this Decree by Law.

### (Article Two)
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers - each within their respective competencies - shall implement this Decree by Law, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>
Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Dr. Subaih Abdul Aziz Abdul Mohsen Al-Mukhaizim <orig>د. صبيح عبد العزيز عبد المحسن المخيزيم</orig>

Issued at Seif Palace <orig>قصر السيف</orig> on: 23 Safar 1447 AH

# Decree-Law No. 129 of 2025
## Approving the Final Account of the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig>
## for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. (32) of 1982 regarding the Civil Information System, and Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, controlling their implementation, and the final account, and the laws amending it,
- And Law No. (3) of 2003 regarding the procedures for issuing certain annexed and independent budgets and their final accounts, amended by Law No. (8) of 2015,
- And Decree-Law No. (23) of 2024 linking the budget of the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding ministerial succession and deputization, and the decrees amending it,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية بالوكالة</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
We have issued the following Decree-Law:

### (Article One)

The final account of the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025 is hereby approved as follows:
a- Expenditures amounted to K.D. 39,286,237.437 (thirty-nine million, two hundred eighty-six thousand, two hundred thirty-seven Dinars and four hundred thirty-seven Fils only), as stated in Table (A) attached to this Decree-Law.
b- Revenues amounted to K.D. 20,138,003.200 (twenty million, one hundred thirty-eight thousand, three Dinars and two hundred Fils only), as stated in Table (B) attached to this Decree-Law.
c- The excess of expenditures over revenues amounted to K.D. 19,148,234.237 (nineteen million, one hundred forty-eight thousand, two hundred thirty-four Dinars and two hundred thirty-seven Fils only), and this excess in expenditures was covered from the budget of Ministries and Government Departments (Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Public Accounts <orig>الحسابات العامة</orig>) for the fiscal year 2024/2025, as stated in Table (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

### (Article Two)

The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers – each within their respective competencies – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into effect from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Decree No. 158 of 2025
## Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship
### From Certain Individuals

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law <orig>قانون الجنسية الكويتية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية بالنيابة</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:
### Article One
Kuwaiti citizenship shall be withdrawn from those mentioned below, and from anyone who may have acquired it through dependency with them:
1- Mohammed Abdullah Hussein Hammoud Al-Enezi <orig>محمد عبدالله حسين حمود العنزي</orig>.
2- Jassim Abdullah Hussein Hammoud Al-Enezi <orig>جاسم عبدالله حسين حمود العنزي</orig>.
3- Ahmed Abdullah Hussein Hammoud Al-Enezi <orig>احمد عبدالله حسين حمود العنزي</orig>.
4- Nadia Sultan Saad Nayef Fateem Al-Mutairi <orig>ناديه سلطان سعد نايف فطيم المطيري</orig>.

### Article Two
The Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية</orig> shall implement this decree, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>
**Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**

Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>
**Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>**

Acting Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية بالنيابة</orig>
**Abdullah Ali Abdullah Al-Salem Al-Sabah <orig>عبد الله علي عبد الله السالم الصباح</orig>**

# Decree No. 157 of 2025

### From Certain Individuals

- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,

7- Muznah Shuja' Arjoon Al-Subaie <orig>مزنه شجاع عرجون السبيعي</orig>.

### Article Two
The Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية</orig> shall implement this decree, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Decree No. 159 of 2025
## Concerning the Appointment of a Non-Resident Ambassador

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. 21 of 1962 regarding the Diplomatic and Consular Corps System, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:

### Article One
Mohammed Tariq Al-Oraifan <orig>محمد طارق العريفان</orig> - Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to the Republic of Armenia - shall be appointed, in addition to his current duties, as a non-resident Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to Georgia.

### Article Two
The Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig> shall implement this Decree, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

  "page_summary": "This page details Ministerial Decision No. (490) of 2025, which amends previous regulations concerning the naming of cities, suburbs, roads, and squares in Kuwait. </header>

## Article One

Articles (4, 5) of the aforementioned Ministerial Resolution No. 2023/507 shall be replaced as follows:

"Article (4):
1- The names of individuals shall not be given to cities, suburbs, and areas, except for those who have held the position of Emir or Crown Prince in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
2- The naming of roads, streets, and squares after individuals shall be restricted to the names of the Rulers of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, kings, sultans, rulers, princes, heads of sisterly and friendly states, historical figures, and some Sheikhs <orig>الشيوخ</orig> from the ruling family. It is also permissible to name them after states, cities, and capitals based on the principle of reciprocity.
3- The names of some roads, streets, and squares that do not bear the names of individuals shall be retained."

"Article (5):
Except for the names of the Rulers of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, kings, sultans, rulers, princes, heads of sisterly and friendly states, historical figures, some Sheikhs <orig>الشيوخ</orig> from the ruling family, and the names of states, cities, and capitals as stipulated in the preceding Article, the naming of roads, streets, and squares shall be suspended, and the approach shall be to number them only."

## Article Two

The competent authorities – each within its jurisdiction – shall implement this Resolution from the date of its issuance, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette.

# Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>
## Administrative Decision No. 110 / 2025 GM regarding the renewal of registration of Badriya Al-Adasani Engineering Consultations Office <orig>مكتب / بدرية العدساني للاستشارات الهندسية</orig> – owned by Engineer / Badriya Fawzi Khalid Al-Adasani <orig>بدرية فوزي خالد العدساني</orig> + change of address + renewal of engineer's registration
Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>
- Having reviewed Law No. (33/2016) concerning Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> and its amendments.
- And Ministerial Decision No. (123/2021) issuing the Professional Practice Regulations for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms <orig>المكاتب الهندسية والدور الاستشارية</orig> and its amendments.
- And Ministerial Decision No. (363/2009) regarding the organization of the Municipality's Executive Apparatus <orig>الجهاز التنفيذي للبلدية</orig> and its branches in the governorates.
- And Ministerial Decision No. (206/2009) regarding the regulation of construction works and its annexed schedules dated 30/4/2009 and its amendments.
- And Administrative Decision No. (84/2025 B) dated 18/6/2025 regarding the re-formation of the Committee for Regulating Professional Practice for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms <orig>لجنة تنظيم مزاولة المهنة للمكاتب الهندسية والدور الاستشارية</orig>.
- And Administrative Decision No. (45/2021) dated 7/2/2021 regarding the renewal of registration of the engineering office.
- And the letter from the Committee for Professional Practice for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms <orig>لجنة مزاولة المهنة للمكاتب الهندسية والدور الاستشارية</orig> No. (01498-2025) dated 10/7/2025.

## Has Decided
### Article One

It has been decided as follows:

### Article One
Those subject to the supervision of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> shall submit applications for registration/listing of registrable offices and positions, in accordance with the form prepared for this purpose as contained in Annex No. (1) of this Resolution, and shall commit to attaching all required documents and information according to the following periods:
1- Occupants of registrable offices and positions currently in service: Shall commit to submitting applications to the Unit at least (90) days before the end of the compliance period.
2- New employees applying to fill registrable offices and positions: Shall commit to submitting applications to the Unit at least (90) days before the expected date of occupying the registrable office or position.
In all cases, none of the powers associated with the registrable office or position may be exercised except after obtaining the Unit's approval.

<header>

filling out the form prepared for this purpose, as contained in Appendix No. (1) of this Resolution.
2. The application shall be submitted by the Chairman of the Board of Directors or the legal representative of the company.
3. The completed form shall be sent via the official email (licenses@iru.gov.kw), and no other means shall be considered valid.
A fee shall also be collected for each application submitted by licensed companies for nominating/registering any registrable positions and jobs. It is required to attach proof of fee payment when submitting the application, and no application that does not meet this condition will be considered.

## Article Three
All submitted applications shall be referred to the competent Interviews Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> for consideration, study, and verification of compliance with the functional suitability criteria and approved controls of the Unit. The Interviews Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> has the right to verify the accuracy of any submitted data and documents by any means it deems appropriate, and it may seek assistance from whomever it deems suitable.
The Committee shall decide on the applications after all required documents are completed and shall submit its recommendation to the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> within (90) days from the date of completion for the issuance of a decision to accept or reject the application.

## Article Four
Entities subject to the supervision of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> shall submit applications for cancellation of registration/enrollment for any registrable positions or jobs in accordance with the procedures set forth in Article Two of this Resolution, within a period not exceeding (5) working days from the date the position or job becomes vacant. This shall be done by filling out the form prepared for this purpose, as contained in Appendix No. (2) of this Resolution, stating the supporting reasons and justifications, and attaching relevant documents.

## Article Five
Subject to Appendix No. (4) of Resolution No. (12) of 2025, entities subject to the supervision of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> shall submit an annual report on the qualification and training of national cadres <orig>الكوادر الوطنية</orig>, no later than (90) days from the end of the fiscal year <orig>السنة المالية</orig> of each year.

## Article Six
Violation of this Resolution shall entail legal liability as stipulated in the Law and its Executive Regulations, without prejudice to other relevant laws.

## Article Seven
This Resolution shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>. All relevant entities shall act accordingly, each within its jurisdiction.

<footer>
Issued on: August 21, 2024
Deputy Head of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>
</footer>

# Appendix No. (1) of Resolution No. (1) of 2025 regarding the mechanism for submitting registration/enrollment applications for registrable positions and jobs

### Form Filling Instructions (1):
1. No application that is incomplete in terms of required information or documents in this form will be considered.
2. If any of the required data, information, or documents in the form are not applicable, "Not Applicable" or "Not Available" should be filled in, with the reason stated.
3. Attach and number all required documents for the data being filled in, in the order shown in the form.
4. Ensure that the data filled in the form matches the attached documents.
5. Ensure that fees have been paid.
6. The date should be filled in as (day/month/year) wherever it appears in the form.
7. Ensure the validity of the Civil ID and/or passport.
8. Supporting documents approved for current employment experience data must be recent.
9. A curriculum vitae will not be considered when reviewing a nomination application unless supporting documents are provided.
10. Licensed persons are responsible for ensuring the form is signed by the legal representative and for providing us with proof thereof.
11. The Unit has the right to request any additional documents or information to ensure the candidate meets the requirements.
12. Submit recent documents in Arabic or translated by an accredited, certified, and officially stamped translation.

Chairman of the Supreme Committee
Mohammed Sulaiman Al-Otaibi <orig>محمد سليمان العتيبي</orig>
Issued on: August 17, 2025
Annex No. (2) of Resolution No. (21) of 2025
Regarding the amendment of Resolution No. (17) of 2025, which amended Resolution No. (14) of 2022
Application Forms for Renewal of Practice License
## First: Instructions
1. It is mandatory to review Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the regulation of insurance, its executive regulations, their amendments, and the resolutions, circulars, and instructions issued by the Insurance Regulatory Unit / Wahdat Tanzim Al-Ta'meen <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> before filling out the form.
2. The company must ensure compliance with all requirements of Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the regulation of insurance, its executive regulations, their amendments, and the resolutions and circulars issued by the Insurance Regulatory Unit / Wahdat Tanzim Al-Ta'meen <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>, and ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information submitted to the Unit before submitting the application.
3. Supporting documents and papers must be submitted according to the order of the application form, signed by the authorized signatory (supported by the company's stamp), and all must be recent, translated into Arabic, certified, and stamped by official authorities, to the headquarters of the Insurance Regulatory Unit / Wahdat Tanzim Al-Ta'meen <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> according to the means and channels specified by the Unit. In addition, a copy of the documents must be submitted via a storage disk (flash memory), with each document named individually according to its type.
4. The Unit will correspond with the company if any additional documents are requested, according to the means and channels specified by the Insurance Regulatory Unit / Wahdat Tanzim Al-Ta'meen <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>. Priority will be given to reviewing applications that fully meet the conditions.
5. Communication with companies regarding any required documents will be through the contact details approved by the Unit for the company, its managers, or the liaison officer. Responses to the Unit must be exclusively through them, and no other email will be recognized, with all legal implications and deadlines ensuing.
6. Communication with the Unit through any email outside the company's electronic domain is prohibited, and no document outside this channel will be recognized.
7. The applicant is bound by their declaration concerning the license, whether it is approval, conditional preliminary approval, or rejection, provided that the latter case is reasoned. An applicant whose request is rejected has the right, after paying the prescribed fee in Article (19) of the Executive Regulations, to appeal within the deadlines specified in these Regulations.
8. In the event that one of the conditions or requirements stated in the form does not apply to the legal or natural person, an official letter signed by the authorized signatory must be submitted, explaining the reasons and justifications, in preparation for its consideration by the Insurance Regulatory Unit / Wahdat Tanzim Al-Ta'meen <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>.
9. The applicant bears responsibility for the accuracy of the data and documents submitted. In the event that the Unit discovers incorrect data, incomplete, or forged documents, the Unit reserves the right to take appropriate measures.

28. A letter of undertaking <orig>كتاب تعهد</orig> to immediately notify the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> if the risk assessor and loss estimator <orig>مقيم الأخطار وتقدير الخسائر</orig> wishes to resign, along with a plan of the procedures to be followed to adjust the company's status.
29. A letter of undertaking <orig>كتاب تعهد</orig> confirming that the company has a Manager / Chief Executive Officer <orig>مدير / رئيس تنفيذي</orig> with practical experience in the field of risk assessment and loss estimation <orig>تقييم الأخطار وتقدير الخسائر</orig> in insurance fields of no less than five years, and that he has practiced risk assessment and loss estimation <orig>تقييم الأخطار وتقدير الخسائر</orig> independently or with a legal entity licensed to work in risk assessment and loss estimation <orig>تقييم الأخطار وتقدير الخسائر</orig> inside or outside the State.
30. A letter of undertaking <orig>كتاب تعهد</orig> that the risk assessment and loss estimation expert <orig>خبير تقييم المخاطر وتقدير الخسائر</orig> is not a shareholder in an insurance company, a member of its board of directors, or one of its employees.
31. A letter of undertaking <orig>كتاب تعهد</orig> that the risk assessment and loss estimation expert <orig>خبير تقييم المخاطر وتقدير الخسائر</orig> is not liable, based on a judicial ruling or disciplinary decision, for a serious violation of any provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> in his capacity as a general manager or a member of the board of directors of a company, including liability for compulsory liquidation of the company.
32. A letter of undertaking <orig>كتاب تعهد</orig> to notify the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> immediately upon updating any data or if any changes occur to the company, including but not limited to (change of phone number / address / email / board members / .... etc.).
33. A letter updating contact person data <orig>كتاب تحديث بيانات ضابط الاتصال</orig>, specifying the name of the primary contact person <orig>ضابط الاتصال الأساسي</orig> and the alternate contact person <orig>ضابط الاتصال البديل</orig>, along with their phone numbers and email addresses, and those of the company.
34. Submission of a letter of acknowledgment and undertaking <orig>كتاب إقرار وتعهد</orig> specifying the company's legal representative <orig>الممثل القانوني للشركة</orig> (the company's legal representative shall be according to the type of company and as stipulated by the Kuwaiti Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات الكويتي</orig>, and in all cases, the company's legal representative is the person legally authorized to represent the company before third parties and official authorities).
35. A statement of judgment enforcement <orig>كشف تنفيذ الأحكام</orig> for companies issued by the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> - General Department of Enforcement <orig>الإدارة العامة للتنفيذ</orig> (plaintiff - defendant statement).
36. A statement submitted by the company listing lawsuits still pending before the judiciary or lawsuits that have not been enforced, with reasons for non-enforcement, provided that the statement includes the minimum following data: Plaintiff's Name / Case Number / Automated Number / Claim Amount / Reason for Non-Enforcement.
Note: The statement must be stamped with the company's seal and signed by its legal representative, with supporting documents proving his legal capacity attached.
37. An acknowledgment and undertaking <orig>إقرار وتعهد</orig> signed by the company's legal representative - and documents proving his legal capacity - stating the following:
a. That the data contained in the statement submitted by it regarding lawsuits still pending before the judiciary are correct.
b. That the company undertakes to settle judgments immediately upon the issuance of the final judgment.
38. Signature authentication <orig>اعتماد توقيع</orig> issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, listing the names of persons authorized to sign on behalf of the company.
39. Criminal record certificate <orig>صحيفة الحالة الجنائية</orig> for the risk assessment and loss estimation expert <orig>خبير تقييم الأخطار وتقدير الخسائر</orig>, founding partners, and beneficial owner.
Form Five: Risk Assessment and Loss Estimation Experts <orig>خبراء تقييم الأخطار وتقدير الخسائر</orig> – Natural Person
1. Receipt of payment for application study fees <orig>رسوم دراسة الطلب</orig> as stipulated in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the regulation of insurance and its amendments.

### Form Nine: Actuarial Experts <orig>الخبراء الاكتواريون</orig> – Natural Person
1. Receipt of payment for application study fees as stipulated in the Executive Regulations of Law No. (125) of 2019 <orig>القانون رقم (125) لسنة 2019</orig> regarding the regulation of insurance and its amendments.

3. Copy of the Civil ID <orig>البطاقة المدنية</orig>.

5. A certificate from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> in the name of the manager, stating that the actuarial expert <orig>الخبير الاكتواري</orig> is not a manager in any other entity and does not hold any individual licenses.
6. A recent certificate from the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>التأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> (insured subscription periods) for the Manager / CEO if he is Kuwaiti.

8. Employment contract.
9. Appointment letter from the company he works for.
10. Curriculum Vitae attached with:
    - a. Educational Qualifications
    - b. Certificates of Practical Experience
    - c. Certificates of Training Courses

# Resolution No. 167/1 - R / 2025
## Governor of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>

## Kuwaiti Swedish Cleaning Services Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية السويدية لخدمات التنظيف</orig>
Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed)

### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### Capital Increase

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Kuwaiti Swedish Cleaning Services Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية السويدية لخدمات التنظيف</orig> - a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) - held its extraordinary meeting to discuss the company's capital increase at 11:30 AM on Tuesday, August 2025, at the head office of Kuwaiti Swedish Cleaning Services Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية السويدية لخدمات التنظيف</orig>, Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> - Salah Al-Din Street <orig>شارع صلاح الدين</orig> - Block: 6 Al-Bahar Building <orig>بناية البحر</orig> Building 18 - Floor: 22.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Abdullah Nasser Musaed Al-Sayer <orig>عبدالله ناصر مساعد الساير</orig> - in his capacity as Chairman of the Board of Directors.
Also present at the meeting: Ms. Rania Yousef Al-Nasser <orig>رانيا يوسف الناصر</orig> - representative of Gulf Securities Depository Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.
- Shareholders holding 1,000,000 shares, representing 100% of the total issued share capital of the company, which amounts to 1,000,000 shares.
After the announcement of the availability of the legal quorum for the validity of the Ordinary General Assembly meeting, the Chairman of the session opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees, and then proceeded to present the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly. Accordingly, after reviewing the agenda, the following decisions were taken:
1.  The reduction of the company's authorized and issued capital from KWD 1,500,000 (one million five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to KWD 1,000,000 (one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) by an amount of KWD 500,000 was discussed due to non-payment of capital.
2.  Approval of the increase of the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 1,000,000 (one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to KWD 2,000,000 (two million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) by issuing 1,000,000 shares (one million shares) equivalent to KWD 1,000,000 (one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) at a value of (KWD 1 - one Dinar <orig>دينار</orig>) per share, as a cash increase payable in one lump sum, allocated to the current shareholders registered in the books

## Decree No. 156 of 2025
### Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship from Certain Individuals

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law <orig>قانون الجنسية الكويتية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية بالنيابة</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:

### Article One
Kuwaiti citizenship shall be withdrawn from those mentioned below and from anyone who may have acquired it through dependency with them:
1- Awad Hadyan Awad Al-Rashidi <orig>عوض هديان عواد الرشيدي</orig>.
2- Hussein Awad Hadyan Awad Al-Rashidi <orig>حسين عوض هديان عواد الرشيدي</orig>.
3- Abdul Rahman Awad Hadyan Awad Al-Rashidi <orig>عبد الرحمن عوض هديان عواد الرشيدي</orig>.
4- Bakr Awad Hadyan Awad Al-Rashidi <orig>بكر عوض هديان عواد الرشيدي</orig>.
5- Hassan Awad Hadyan Awad Al-Rashidi <orig>حسن عوض هديان عواد الرشيدي</orig>.
6- Barakat Awad Hadyan Awad Al-Rashidi <orig>بركات عوض هديان عواد الرشيدي</orig>.
7- Duha Awad Hadyan Awad Al-Rashidi <orig>ضحا عوض هديان عواد الرشيدي</orig>.
8- Amina Awad Hadyan Awad Al-Rashidi <orig>أمينه عوض هديان عواد الرشيدي</orig>.
9- Hasna Awad Hadyan Awad Al-Rashidi <orig>حسنه عوض هديان عواد الرشيدي</orig>.
10- Khaira Awad Hadyan Awad Al-Rashidi <orig>خيره عوض هديان عواد الرشيدي</orig>.

### Article Two
The Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية</orig> shall implement this Decree, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

### Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
### Correction
A typographical error occurred in Decree No. 155 of 2025, published in Issue 1752 dated 17/8/2025 AD.
The error was in the subject of the Decree (Regarding the transfer of a Diwan Ambassador to the General Diwan of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs).
The correct wording is (Regarding the transfer of an Ambassador to the General Diwan of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs).
Therefore, we are re-publishing after correcting the error.

## Decree No. 155 of 2025
### Regarding the Transfer of an Ambassador to the General Diwan of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. 21 of 1962 regarding the Diplomatic and Consular Corps System <orig>نظام السلكين الدبلوماسي والقنصلي</orig> and its amending laws,
- And based on the submission of the Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:

### Article One
Mr. Thamer Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>ثامر جابر الأحمد الصباح</orig> - Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to the Kingdom of Bahrain <orig>مملكة البحرين</orig> shall be transferred to the General Diwan of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>ديوان عام وزارة الخارجية</orig>.

### Article Two
The Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig> shall implement this Decree, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Ahmed Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبد الله الأحمد الصباح</orig>

Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig>
Abdullah Ali Abdullah Al-Yahya <orig>عبدالله علي عبدالله اليحيا</orig>

2. A valid certificate from the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> (entity civil number).
3. A valid National Labor Percentage Fulfillment Certificate <orig>شهادة استيفاء نسبة العمالة الوطنية</orig>.
4. An authorization letter and a copy of the civil ID for the company representative to purchase the booklet.
- For inquiries, please contact Contracts and Tenders Control <orig>مراقبة العقود والمناقصات</orig>: Switchboard <orig>بدالة</orig> 1800008
- Extension 2710. Inquiries should be sent to the email:
m.altabtabaie@cmgs.gov.kw

In case of purchasing practice documents and paying the prescribed fees, requests for fee refunds will not be accepted except in the event of cancellation of the practice in accordance with the provisions of Article (55) of the Public Tenders Law <orig>قانون المناقصات العامة</orig>.
- The final time for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the announcement for depositing bids.
- A general practice in accordance with the provisions of Article (17) of Public Tenders Law <orig>قانون المناقصات العامة</orig> No. (49) of 2016.
- The practice is indivisible.
- Alternative offers are not accepted.
- The mentioned cash payment is made by K-Net card.
- Companies/practitioners wishing to submit inquiries or clarifications must adhere to submitting them to the Council at the time and place specified above in the table for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). No inquiries or clarifications submitted after the date will be considered.
- All documents must be submitted on (3) non-copyable CDs, except for the bid format and initial insurance, which must be submitted as hard copies.
- A valid National Labor Percentage Fulfillment Certificate <orig>شهادة استيفاء نسبة العمالة الوطنية</orig> issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> must be submitted with the bid.
- In accordance with the text of Article 48 of Public Tenders Law <orig>قانون المناقصات العامة</orig> No. 49 of 2016.
- Bid envelopes will be opened at the time and place indicated in the practice documents in a public session attended by bidders or their representatives.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for practitioners wishing to attend the bid opening session.
- Companies wishing to attend the bid opening must bring the following documents (copy of civil ID - copy of signature authorization <orig>اعتماد التوقيع</orig>).
- In case of attendance by a person other than the authorized signatory, a written letter from the authorized signatory at the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات</orig> authorizing the person they deem fit to attend the session must be presented.

The final time for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the above announcement for depositing bids.
Bidders and practitioners must adhere to the instructions regarding the submission and deposit of bids on the CD available on the Agency's website WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.
The aforementioned cash payment must be made by certified check or K-Net card.
Companies / bidders wishing to submit inquiries or clarifications, etc., must adhere to submitting them to the concerned entity at the time and place specified above in the schedule for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session), and no attention will be paid to any inquiries or clarifications submitted to the Agency.
All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, except for the bid form and the initial security deposit, which must be submitted as hard copies.
Indivisible
A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid.
The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector, noting that bids not including this certificate will be excluded.
This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as companies wishing to attend the bid opening session are entitled to do so.
Companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the Bid Opening Department <orig>قسم فض العطاءات</orig> before the day scheduled for the bid opening session and bring the following documents:
1. A copy of the Civil ID.
2. A copy of the signature authorization for the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
3. In case of attendance by a person other than the authorized signatory, a written letter from the authorized signatory at the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> must be presented, authorizing the designated person to attend the session.
Owners of Small and Medium Enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempt from the fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016.
Owners of Small and Medium Enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to bid must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development and Care <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
This announcement is considered an integral part of the tender documents.
For more information, please visit our website at WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.

The Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> announces the postponement of the bid submission deadline for the aforementioned tender to Tuesday, 25-09-2025, instead of Sunday, 24-08-2025.

- The last deadline for submitting bids is 10:00 AM on Sunday, 07-09-2025, at the Electrical Distribution Networks Emergency Building in Al-Salem <orig>السالم</orig> Area, Block (1), next to the National Control Center <orig>مركز التحكم الوطني</orig>.
- The practice documents will be published on the Agency's website for review before purchasing the documents. In case of purchasing the documents and paying the prescribed fees, requests for fee refunds will not be accepted except in the event of cancellation of the practice in accordance with the provisions of Article (55) of the Public Tenders Law <orig>قانون المناقصات العامة</orig>.
- The final time for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the above announcement for bid submission.
- General practice in accordance with the provisions of Article No. (17) of Public Tenders Law <orig>قانون المناقصات العامة</orig> No. (49) of 2016.

- Non-conforming offers are not accepted.
- The above-mentioned cash consideration shall be paid by certified cheque or K-Net <orig>كي نت</orig> card.

- All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable (CD), except for the bid form and preliminary insurance, which must be submitted as hard copies.

- Interested companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the Bids Department <orig>قسم العطاءات</orig> before the specified date for the bid opening session and bring the following documents:

# Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig>
## Announcement Regarding
### Practice No. M.A.M / 2025/3/2
### Provision of Maintenance and Technical Support Services for Computers, Printers,
### Scanners, and Engineering Plotters

The Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig> announces an open internal practice conducted by sealed envelope method for the provision of maintenance and technical support services for computers, printers, scanners, and engineering plotters, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the following documents:
- Document (1-1) - General Terms and Conditions
- Document (1-2) - Special Terms and Conditions
- Document (2-2) - Technical Terms and Specifications
- Document (3-2) - Bid Form
- Document (3-6) - Bill of Quantities and Prices
- Document (5-1) - Appendix of Additional Terms

1- These documents can be obtained from the Procurement and Stores Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات والمخازن</orig> at the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig> during official working hours for a non-refundable fee of: K.D. 75/- (Seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>), provided that the documents are handed over to the authorized representative of the company or establishment purchasing them by virtue of an official letter.
2- The deadline for submitting bids to the Procurement and Stores Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات والمخازن</orig> at the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig> is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 31/8/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.
3- The bidder must be a Kuwaiti company registered with the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig> and the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>جهاز المناقصات العامة</orig>.
4- The bidder must be a company that has executed similar projects in ministries and government entities in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> and has at least ten years of work experience. Supporting documents must be attached.
5- The amount of the preliminary guarantee is: 2% of the total bid value. This guarantee must be valid for the duration of the bid validity period, in the form of a certified check or an unconditional letter of guarantee issued by one of the approved Kuwaiti banks <orig>البنوك الكويتية</orig> in favor of the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig>. The bidder may not claim any interest on the amount of this guarantee.
6- The amount of the final guarantee is: 10% of the total contract value, in the form of an unconditional letter of guarantee free from any reservations, issued by one of the approved Kuwaiti banks <orig>البنوك الكويتية</orig> in favor of the Ministry. The second party may not claim any interest on the guarantee amount, and no interest shall be paid thereon.
7- The contract execution period is: one year (365 days).
8- The bid shall remain valid for 90 days (ninety days) from the date of opening the bid envelopes.
9- The practice is indivisible.
10- Alternative offers will not be accepted.
11- This practice is open to all companies and establishments holding an agency registration certificate issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> or an authorized and qualified distributor for this work, registered with the Ministry in the suppliers' register and with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the year 2025.

2- The deadline for submitting bids to the Procurement and Stores Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات والمخازن</orig> at the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig> is 1:00 PM on Wednesday, 27/8/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

## Equipment Holding Company K.S.C. (Public) <orig>شركة المعدات القابضة ش. م. ك. ع</orig>
### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting (Adjourned)
The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting (Adjourned) of Equipment Holding Company <orig>شركة المعدات القابضة</orig> was held at 12:00 PM on Tuesday, 05/08/2025, at the company's headquarters located in Al-Ahmadi <orig>الأحمدي</orig> - Block 8 - Plot 43 - East Al-Ahmadi <orig>شرق الأحمدي</orig>.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Dhirar Khalid Al-Rabbah <orig>ضرار خالد الرباح</orig> - Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer.
Also present at the meeting were:
- Mr. Fahad Al-Hudaib <orig>فهد الهديب</orig>, representative of Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>
After the legal quorum was met with the presence of shareholders owning 54.103% of the company's total share capital, Mr. Dhirar Khalid Al-Rabbah <orig>ضرار خالد الرباح</orig> opened the session in the name of God, welcoming the attendees. The Assembly then proceeded to discuss the topics on the agenda, which were deliberated by the attendees, and the following decisions were taken:
1. The reduction of the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 8,000,000 (Eight Million Kuwaiti Dinars only) to KWD 2,500,000 was discussed.

K.D. (five million five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only) and approved unanimously by those present.

2. Approval to increase the authorized capital was discussed, from K.D. 2,500,000 (two million five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only) to K.D. 10,000,000 (ten million Kuwaiti Dinars only), distributed over 100,000,000 shares with a par value of 100 fils per share, to increase the authorized capital by K.D. 7,500,000. The General Assembly authorized the Board of Directors to call up the issued and paid-up capital within the limits of the authorized capital, with authorization for the Board of Directors to determine the amount and methods of the increase, its call-up dates, and all its terms and conditions, as well as to determine the issue premium for the new shares and approve it unanimously by those present.

3. The increase of the issued and paid-up capital was discussed, from K.D. 2,500,000 (two million five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only) to K.D. 8,000,000 (eight million Kuwaiti Dinars only) in cash, by issuing 55,000,000 shares with a par value of 100 fils per share and an issue premium of (6 fils) per share, for a total value of K.D. 5,830,000 (five million eight hundred thirty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only). These shares are to be allocated to shareholders registered in the company's shareholder register on the entitlement date as a priority right, with a share of the new shares proportionate to their number of shares. New shareholders may enter after the end of the legal subscription period, with authorization for the Board of Directors to set the controls, rules, and conditions for calling up the capital in one lump sum, disposing of fractional shares if any, confirming and changing the call-up date, and determining the timeline for trading the priority right, and approved unanimously by those present.

4. The amendment of Article No. (6) of the Articles of Incorporation and Article No. (5) of the Company's Articles of Association concerning capital was discussed to become as follows:
* Text before amendment:
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital was set at K.D. 8,000,000 (eight million Kuwaiti Dinars), equivalent to 80,000,000 shares (eighty million shares), and all shares are cash shares.
* Text after amendment:
The company's authorized capital was set at K.D. 10,000,000 (ten million Kuwaiti Dinars), distributed over 100,000,000 shares, with a value of (100) fils per share, and all shares are cash shares.
The company's issued capital was set at K.D. 8,000,000 (eight million Kuwaiti Dinars), distributed over 80,000,000 shares, with a value of (100) fils per share, and all shares are cash shares.
The company's paid-up capital was set at K.D. 2,500,000 (two million five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), distributed over 25,000,000 shares, with a value of (100) fils per share. All shares are cash shares, subject to the approval of the competent authorities and ratified unanimously by those present.

# Digital Aligner Advertising Company <orig>شركة ديجيتال الاينسر للدعاية والإعلان</orig>
K.S.C. (Closed)

## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of the shareholders of Digital Aligner Advertising Company <orig>شركة ديجيتال الاينسر للدعاية والإعلان</orig> K.S.C. (Closed) was held on Monday, August 18, 2025, at 10:00 AM at the address located in Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> - intersection of Al-Jahra Street <orig>شارع الجهراء</orig> with Airport Road <orig>طريق المطار</orig> - Noor Building <orig>مبنى نور</orig> - Ground Floor, next to the Kuwaiti Red Crescent <orig>الهلال الأحمر الكويتي</orig>. The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> was notified of the agenda, date, and venue of the General Assembly by virtue of a letter dated 03/08/2025, in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. (1) of 2016, and a receipt was obtained from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> on 05/05/2025.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Ahmed Ghannam Al-Shammari <orig>أحمد غنام الشمري</orig> - Chairman of the Board of Directors. The following also attended the meeting:
*   Mr. Mohammed Bandar Al-Hawwas <orig>محمد بندر الحواس</orig> - Representative of Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.
*   Shareholders owning 4,899,998 shares by proxy, representing 98.000% of the total capital shares of 5,000,000 shares.
After the announcement of the availability of the legal quorum necessary for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, the Chairman of the session, Mr. Ahmed Ghannam Al-Shammari <orig>أحمد غنام الشمري</orig>, opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees and thanking them for accepting the invitation. Thereafter, the Extraordinary General Assembly proceeded to discuss the item on its agenda regarding the consideration of the company's future and issued the following resolutions:
1.  The attending shareholders unanimously approved the declaration of voluntary liquidation of the company in accordance with the laws of the State of Kuwait and the provisions contained in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, its executive regulations, and their subsequent amendments.
2.  The attending shareholders unanimously approved the appointment of Mr. Ahmed Ghannam Ali Al-Shammari <orig>أحمد غنام علي الشمري</orig> as the legal liquidator for the company, granting him all powers provided for under the laws of the State of Kuwait. The liquidation period was set for one year until the completion of the liquidation work.
3.  The attending shareholders unanimously approved setting the liquidator's fees at a total amount of KWD 600 (Six Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars only).
Accordingly, the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting concluded at 10:30 AM on the same day.

### Extraordinary General Assembly Agenda

1- Approval of the Board of Directors' recommendation to reduce the number of Board members from (5) to (3) members.

*   **Text Before Amendment:**
    The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (5) (five members) elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot. Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining Board members except to the extent exceeding the percentage used in appointing their representatives to the Board of Directors. Shareholders shall elect Board members by secret ballot, and the term of membership on the Board shall be three years, renewable.

*   **Text After Amendment:**
    The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (3) (three members) elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot. Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining Board members except to the extent exceeding the percentage used.

Mr. Barrak Abdul Mohsen Al-Otaiqi <orig>براك عبدالمحسن العتيقي</orig>, the current liquidator of the company, submitted his resignation to the Extraordinary General Assembly (Adjourned) due to the presence of shares in companies under liquidation that have not yet been completed and may require a longer period to finalize their liquidation work. ### Kuwaiti Family Office for Investment Consulting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة مكتب العائلة الكويتية للاستشارات الاستثمارية ش.م.م</orig>
### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on Sunday, August 10, 2025
Based on Board of Directors Meeting No. 2025/5 held on July 09, 2025, and the invitation issued by the Chairman of the Board of Directors to attend the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting to discuss the agenda items, the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was held on Sunday, August 10, 2025, at 10:00 AM via the electronic system after voting was opened since Saturday, July 31, 2025, through the electronic system of the Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>, with the attendance of shareholders representing 9,900,000 shares, in person and by proxy, constituting 99% of the company's total capital of K.D. 1,000,000 (One Million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). The completion of the necessary quorum for the valid convening of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was announced, then the agenda items were read for discussion, and the Extraordinary General Assembly issued its approval regarding the following resolutions:
**Item One:** Voting on the amendment of Article 27 of the Company's Articles of Association (Board of Directors) according to the following wording:
**Text Before Amendment:**
"Article 27- A- Board of Directors – The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of five (5) members. The term of membership shall be three years, renewable. If a new Board of Directors cannot be elected within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors is elected."
**Text After Amendment:**
"Article 27- A- Board of Directors – The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of five (5) members, and the majority of the Board members shall be non-executive members, and 20% of the Board members shall be independent members, provided that the number of independent members does not exceed half of the Board members. The term of membership shall be three years, renewable. If a new Board of Directors cannot be elected within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors is elected."
The meeting concluded at 10:10 AM.
Chairman of the Board of Directors
