## Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>
### Announcement
**Re-issuance of Practice No. MM / 3 / 2026-2025**
**Supply, Installation, Operation, Maintenance, and Warranty of a 3D Shaping Device for Student Training**
**For the need of / The General Technical Guidance for Scientific Studies <orig>التوجيه الفني العام للدراسات العلمية</orig>**

The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces a (public) practice for the supply, installation, operation, maintenance, and warranty of a 3D shaping device in accordance with the terms and technical specifications in the practice documents.
General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (general) for practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- Applicants for this practice must be specialized establishments / companies within Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> in the works subject to the practice, registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their bid confirming this, with dates concurrent with the date of the practice issuance.
3- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers.
4- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.

### Announcement
**Re-issuance of Practice No. MM / 31 / 2026-2025**
**Supply, Installation, Operation, Maintenance, and Warranty of Special Sound Machines and Equipment / Educational Technologies Department <orig>إدارة التقنيات التربوية</orig>**

The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces a (public) practice for the supply, installation, operation, maintenance, and warranty of special sound machines and equipment in accordance with the terms and technical specifications in the practice documents.
General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (general) for practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- Applicants for this practice must be specialized establishments / companies within Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> in the works subject to the practice, registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their bid confirming this, with dates concurrent with the date of the practice issuance.
3- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers.
4- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.

Connecting the Ministry's General Diwan network to educational zones and departments, along with the supply, transport, installation, operation, and maintenance of attached devices, and providing technical support, all in accordance with the general and special terms and conditions, required technical specifications and requirements, quantity schedules, and generally all provisions contained in the tender documents and the contract to be concluded based thereon.

### General Instructions for Tenderers:

1.  The tender is open to approved tenderers registered with the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2.  Applicants for this tender must be specialized companies within Kuwait in the works subject to the tender, registered in the Commercial Register and with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach certificates to their bid confirming this, with dates concurrent with the tender issuance date.
3.  This tender is indivisible, and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers.
4.  The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the tender documents is (75 K.D.) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>د.ك</orig>.
5.  The bid must be accompanied by a preliminary security deposit of (2,000.000 K.D.) Two Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>. The preliminary security deposit shall be submitted by certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>. This security must be valid for the duration of the bid's validity, and any bid not accompanied by this security will be excluded. Preliminary security deposits shall not be refunded until (90) days have passed from the tender closing date, or when the winning tenderer submits the final security deposit and signs the contract, unless the tender is cancelled. The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> will not pay any interest on the security deposit amount to the tenderer for the amount held.
6.  The total duration of the contract is (18) eighteen months, during which the contractor is committed to executing the tender works, in accordance with the general and special terms, conditions, and technical specifications contained in the tender documents.
7.  The bidder accepts that their bid shall remain valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period and the award obligation. No price reduction will be considered after the bid submission. The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> has the right to request an extension of the bid's validity period until the final decision on bids and the award of the tender are completed.
8.  If, upon studying the tender, the tenderer discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or quantity schedules that may affect their bid categories or value, they must, before preparing and submitting their bid, seek clarification in writing from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>. The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> will review these observations and inquiries if they are serious, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>.
9.  Tender documents shall be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Stores Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (10) ten days from the date of advertisement publication, at exactly (12:00) noon, according to the decision issued by the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> regarding changing or setting the closing date. No bid received after the specified closing date will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
10. The tenderer must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary equipment and machinery for executing the works subject to the tender – if any – within the same bid documents submitted. The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> has the right to reject any bid that does not include the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to what is stated in the technical specifications and conditions of the tender.
11. The tenderer must submit all bank guarantees related to this tender in Arabic.
12. Submission of samples is required.

# Announcement

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the offering of Practice No.: S / MS / 2026/14 for the supply, installation, and warranty of a gas monitoring device for gases generated from the medical waste treatment process at Kabad Incinerator 1 <orig>محرقة كبد 1</orig>, among companies specialized in this field, in accordance with the general and special conditions outlined in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website www.moh.gov.kw, upon payment of an amount of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, non-refundable.
It is necessary to attach a letter from the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig> when submitting the booklet, stating compliance with the National Labor Support Law <orig>قانون دعم العمالة الوطنية</orig> in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2000 and Cabinet Resolution No. 1104 / Fifth of 2008 regarding the support and encouragement of national labor.
The closing date for the practice shall be Monday, 2025/9/15, at the tenders box in the Ministry's General Diwan (Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبخات</orig> – Ministry of Health Building <orig>مبنى وزارة الصحة</orig> – First Floor – Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> – Practices Section <orig>قسم الممارسات</orig>). Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, and the preliminary guarantee shall be (2%) only two percent of the bid value, valid throughout the bid's validity period.
Note: Priority is given to owners of small and medium-sized enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Health <orig>وكيل وزارة الصحة</orig>

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction

The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale of the property described below by public auction on Wednesday, 17/9/2025 – Hall 5 – on the eighth floor of the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> at 9:00 AM – in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuits No. 2022/567 and 2024/59 Sales/2.

Filed by: Bader Lafi Khalid Al-Mutairi <orig>بدر لافي خالد المطيري</orig>.
Against:
1- Saud Mubarak Abdul Jameeli <orig>سعود مبارك عبد الجميلي</orig>.
2- Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>.
3- Commercial Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك التجاري الكويتي</orig>.

## First: Property Description:

- The property, document No. 1988/2935, is located in Al-Doha Residential Area <orig>منطقة الدوحة السكنية</orig> – Plot No. 14 – Block 15 – Piece No. 1 – from plan No. M/27025 – with an area of 357.5 m² for the amount of / 238,500 K.D. (Two hundred thirty-eight thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>)
According to the description certificate,
Violations exist, namely: 1- There is an unauthorized structure on the roof. 2- There is an unlicensed diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> made of light materials under the canopy.
**And according to the expert's report.
During the expert session dated 22/2/2024, we moved to the property subject of the lawsuit, located in Al-Doha Area <orig>منطقة الدوحة</orig>, Piece (1) – Street (3) – House (13) – Plot (1514), which bears the automated number (14078917), to inspect the disputed property on site, in the presence and guidance of the first defendant's son personally, and with the assistance of Mr. Knowledge Expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> / Abdulaziz Al-Dughaishim <orig>عبدالعزيز الدغيشيم</orig> from the administration. The inspection was carried out as follows:–
1- The property subject of the lawsuit is a private residence with an area of 357.5 m² as per document No. 1988/2935.
2- The first defendant's son stated that the current occupants of the property are the first defendant, his wife, his 6 children, and grandchildren, and that the property is not rented.
3- The property was inspected from the outside according to the guidance of the first defendant's son, who stated that the first defendant's condition was critical as he had been discharged from the hospital yesterday, and requested inspection of the property from the outside, where he guided about its components as follows:
- The property is located on an internal street with a setback and consists of a ground floor, first floor, and a half floor.
- The flooring is ceramic, air conditioning units are split, and there is no elevator.
- The ground floor consists of: – (2) living rooms + kitchen + master bedroom + (2) bathrooms + diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> and its bathroom.
- The first floor consists of: – (4) apartments, each apartment consisting of a master bedroom + (2) bedrooms and a bathroom + living room + kitchen.
- The half floor is an apartment consisting of a master bedroom + (4) bedrooms + (2) bathrooms + kitchen + living room.
- There is also a maid's room, a bathroom, and a laundry room on the roof.
- Mr. Knowledge Expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> inspected the property and took all observations in preparation for estimating the value of the land, buildings, and the total for the property subject of the lawsuit.

* The ground floor consists of [ 2 living rooms + 2 bathrooms + maid's room + laundry room ]
* The first floor consists of [ an apartment consisting of ( 2 rooms + living room + bathroom ) + 2 master bedrooms with bathroom + small living room + bathroom + 2 rooms ].
The interior finishing of the property is old, and new in the annex. The flooring in most of the property is ceramic, and in the rooms it is carpet. The courtyard flooring is tiles. The walls are painted, ceilings are gypsum, doors are wood, lighting is spotlights, and air conditioning in the property is central, except for the annex which has split units.
The property subject of the lawsuit is in the possession of the defendants and is used as a private residence.
Mr. Knowledge Expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> inspected the disputed property on site, reviewed the lawsuit file, and took relevant observations in preparation for preparing his report on the value of the property subject of the lawsuit, land and building, and the total according to market price.

## Second: Auction Terms:

First: The auction shall start at the basic price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by depositing the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Firstly: Property Description: According to the attached description certificates.
Property document number 2006/678 located in Al-Farwaniya <orig>الفروانية</orig> - Plot No. (35), Block No. (73) of plan No. M/31585, with an area of 768 m2, at a basic price of K.D. 1,485,000 (one million four hundred eighty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
**Note**: There is a violation of increased shop area according to the Municipality's letter.
**Inspection**:
The expert committee began the session by moving to the property subject of the lawsuit in Al-Farwaniya <orig>الفروانية</orig> area, Block 2, Street 81, Plot 31, automated number (82231358), in the presence of those who previously attended the inspection of the first property, and the following was revealed:
The property is a building located on two streets (a wide alley) and consists of a mezzanine and 6 identical floors.
The ground floor (mezzanine) contains 4 apartments, detailed as: 2 apartments consisting of (hall + room + bathroom + kitchen), one apartment consisting of (hall + 2 rooms + bathroom + kitchen), and one studio apartment (room + bathroom + kitchen).
The ground floor has a shop, rented as a salon for a monthly rent of K.D. 700, according to the plaintiff's agent's statement.
The building consists of 6 floors, each floor containing 4 identical apartments, each apartment comprising (hall + 2 rooms + bathroom + kitchen), with a note that apartment rents vary from K.D. 210-230 per month, according to the plaintiff's agent's statement.
The rooftop is empty.

Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price specified for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them in the preceding session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are requested to proceed at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall be considered a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."
Deputy Chief Justice of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

The Disputed Property:

Secondly: Auction Conditions:

Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a full deposit in the auction. Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be resumed at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. Property Description:
The entire property under Document No. 2014/601, for which ownership document No. 2021/2301 was issued, located in Al-Mahboula <orig>المهبولة</orig> area - Plot No. 218 - Block No. 5 - Plan M 33966 - with an area of 800 m², by public auction at a base price of K.D. 1,705,860 (One Million Seven Hundred Five Thousand Eight Hundred Sixty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
And according to the description certificate.
The property was found to be an investment residence consisting of a shop + ground floor + 15 repeated floors + roof, and the owner committed several violations.
Construction of an illegal external fence obstructing car entry + change of swimming pool location leading to the cancellation of parking spaces from No. 86, unlicensed construction on the ground floor with an area of 35 m², violation of incorporating all light wells on repeated floors with a total area of 69 m², expansion and construction, and violation on all repeated floors with an area of 580 m².
** And according to the expert's report
The property subject of the dispute, located in Al-Mahboula <orig>المهبولة</orig> area, Block 2 (currently), Main Street No. 20 and Inner Street No. 226, Plot 218, where the inspection was carried out as follows:
The property subject of the dispute is a building overlooking a main street, an inner street, and a side alley, with its facades covered in cinema <orig>بسنيما</orig>, and an area of 800 square meters.
The property subject of the dispute consists of the following:
Ground Floor: Reception hall, health club, guard room, and a swimming pool in the courtyard, and there is a shop overlooking the main street (grocery store).
First Floor to Fifteenth Floor: Consists of two apartments, where the first apartment consists of a living room, two bedrooms, three bathrooms, a kitchen, and a balcony, and the second apartment consists of a living room, two bedrooms, three bathrooms, a kitchen, a maid's room with its bathroom, and a balcony.
Sixteenth Floor: Consists of two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen, and a roof.
The air conditioning of the property subject of the dispute is central air conditioning, and there are two elevators in the property, and the apartments are furnished but not utilized.
Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall commence at the base price indicated for the property, and participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price, in which case the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session, and no bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit.

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction (Mubarak Al-Kabeer <orig>مبارك الكبير</orig>)

Mubarak Al-Kabeer <orig>مبارك الكبير</orig> - Plot No. 98 - Block No. 2 - from Plan No. M/37548
with a total area of 400 m2, by public auction, with a base price of (K.D. 159,000) one hundred and fifty-nine thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> for the share offered for sale.
*   **The certificate of description stated the existence of violations, namely, additional construction without a license on the ground floor from the service road side, and there are light bridge materials on the service road side, and there is a violation that does not conform to the plan.**
*   **According to the expert's report,**
    the property is located in Mubarak Al-Kabeer <orig>مبارك الكبير</orig> area, Block 2, Street 44, Plot 98, House 2, Automated Number 91641101. We located the property subject of the lawsuit on the area map using the **Kuwait Finder** program, and the inspection was carried out as follows:
    *   The disputed property is a government house located on a corner, bordered by a neighbor on the right side and a transformer on the left side.
    *   The disputed property conforms to the special and general specifications of Document No. 2022/1194, with an area of 400m2.
    *   The exterior cladding of the property subject of the lawsuit is limestone bricks.
    *   The property subject of the lawsuit has (3) entrances.
    *   The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a ground floor, first floor, and second floor, with the following details:
        *   The ground floor consists of a hallway + bathroom + (2) living rooms + kitchen + bedroom + (2) bathrooms.
        *   The first floor consists of (2) apartments, each apartment consisting of (2) rooms + bathroom + preparatory kitchen.
        *   The second floor consists of (4) rooms + living room + (2) bathrooms + preparatory kitchen.
    *   The property's air conditioning consists of units.
    *   The property does not contain an electric elevator.
    *   The first defendant stated that the property is not rented and that he, his wife, his children, his brothers, and his mother occupy the property.

## Secondly: Auction Conditions:

1.  Firstly: The auction shall commence at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
2.  Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
3.  Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
4.  Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
5.  Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by a full deposit of its value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
6.  Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
7.  Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
8.  Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates ignorance.
    Notice:
    1.  This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
    2.  The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
    3.  The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Deputy Chief Justice of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Property document No. 2001/343 located in Sahibat Al-Shuhada <orig>صاحبة الشهداء</orig> area – plot No. (13) – block (5) with an area of 400m2 from plan No. M/37698, for which ownership proof document No. 2003/7542 was issued.

*Inspection:
During the expert session dated 2023/10/18 (Expert Report No. 4), we proceeded to inspect the property subject of the lawsuit located in Sahibat Al-Shuhada <orig>صاحبة الشهداء</orig>, block (5) – Street (518) – plot (13) – house (23) – automated number (15973577), in the presence of the plaintiff's agent, the third and fifth defendants, the lawyer representing the second to fifth defendants, and in discussion with the study expert, Professor Yousef Al-Rabee' <orig>يوسف الربيع</orig>. The first and sixth defendants failed to attend the inspection session despite their knowledge of the lawsuit's progress. The inspection revealed the following:
- The property subject of the lawsuit is a private residential plot with an area of 400m2, located on a single street, consisting of a basement, ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a roof, with an external stone cladding.
- The plot contains one elevator, and the air conditioning is central.
- The ground floor consists of (3) halls + two bathrooms + washbasins and a bathroom + a washbasin + a master bedroom + a kitchen + a maid's room + a storage room.
- The first floor consists of a master bedroom + a bathroom + a laundry room + a balcony + an apartment containing a bedroom + a master bedroom + a master bedroom with a dressing room + a bathroom.
- The second floor consists of an apartment containing a hall + a kitchen + two bathrooms + a master bedroom + two bedrooms + a dressing room + a balcony.
- The roof contains a large storage room.
- The basement consists of [a hall + a bathroom + a preparatory kitchen + a large storage room and another small one].
The study expert recorded his observations after inspecting the plot.
The actual occupants of the plot currently are the second, third, fourth, and sixth defendants, according to the personal statement of the fifth defendant, who stated that the first defendant, before their father's death, lived with them in the plot with his wife and children. She also stated that the plaintiff used the entire basement for herself, but she had moved out before the date of filing the lawsuit on 2022/11/28.

Second: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall start at the basic price of (530,000 K.D.) five hundred and thirty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. Fifth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Secondly: Property under document No. 1996/2463, located in Salwa <orig>سلوى</orig> area - Block No. 4 - Plot 19 - Plan M/37073, with an area of 435 m², by public auction with a base price of KWD 480,000 (Four Hundred Eighty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

Property Document No. 2003/14033 located in Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقة</orig> – Plot 151 – Block 4 – from Plan No. M/27029 B – with an area of 400 m2.

*Inspection:*
On 16/10/2023, the expert proceeded to inspect the subject of the dispute located in Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقة</orig> area, Block 4, Street 14, House 35, Plot 151, Automated Unit Number 13322666, in the presence and guidance of the second defendant personally, as he is the resident and occupant of the property, and in the presence of Mr. Tariq Al-Moajel <orig>طارق المعجل</orig>, the knowledge expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> assisted by the administration. The other defendants failed to attend. After scrutiny and inspection, the expert found the following:
1 – The property subject to the dispute has an area of 400m2 according to Document No. 14033 dated 22/10/2003.
2 – The property subject to the dispute is a private residence overlooking two streets ("front and back"), bordered by a neighbor to the right and to the left. The exterior cladding is beige Sigma, and there is a setback of approximately 5m in front with 5 shaded parking spaces.
3 – The property subject to the dispute consists of two floors, a roof, and an annex, with the following details:
a – The ground floor consists of a hall + 2 rooms + 2 bathrooms + a preparatory kitchen + and has 3 entrances from the front of the house and a fourth entrance from the back.
b – The annex consists of a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> with its bathroom and a separate entrance, an external kitchen, and a maid's room.
c – The first floor consists of 5 rooms + 2 bathrooms + a main kitchen.
d – The roof is empty.
4 – Air conditioning is split units and window units. The flooring is ceramic. Lighting is spot lights. The house is close to services: mosque, cooperative society, and police station. It has a courtyard around the house and tiled flooring.
5 – Mr. Tariq Al-Moajel <orig>طارق المعجل</orig>, the knowledge expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> assisted by the administration, took the necessary notes in preparation for estimating the current value of the property and preparing his report.

Second: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall start with a basic price of K.D. 300,000 (Three Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session will be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement shall be published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

Notice:
1 – This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2 – The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3 – The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract."

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction
The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale of the property described below by public auction on Monday, 2025/9/22 – Hall 5 – on the eighth floor of the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> at 9:00 AM – in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 402/2023 Sales/1 <orig>بيوع/1</orig>
Filed by: Adel Rashoud Ali Al-Enezi <orig>عادل رشود علي العنزي</orig>.
Against:
1– Alia Jedeaan Ali Al-Enezi <orig>عليا جديعان علي العنزي</orig>.
2– The Director General <orig>مدير عام</orig> of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> in his capacity.

## Property Description: (According to the attached description certificate)
Property document No. 2017/4376 located in Abu Ftaira <orig>أبو فطيرة</orig> area – Plot No. 393 – Block No. 8 – Plan M/37883, with an area of 400 m2, to be sold by public auction at a base price of K.D. 540,000 (Five Hundred and Forty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

** According to the description certificate:
- The property is located within a private residential area, consisting of a basement + ground floor + first floor + part of the second floor, and the property conforms to the plan.

** According to the expert's report:
On 2022/12/14, we moved to the disputed property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> located in Abu Ftaira <orig>أبو فطيرة</orig> area, in the presence of the plaintiff personally and his agent, the first defendant personally, and Mr. Expert of Knowledge <orig>خبير الدراية</orig>. The second defendant failed to appear. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The disputed property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> is located in Abu Ftaira <orig>أبو فطيرة</orig> area, Block (8), Street (192), Plot No. (393), House No. (10), Automated Number (94085542).
- The area of the disputed property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> is (400 m2) and it has a southern facade, conforming to ownership document No. (2010/11716).
- The disputed property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> is bordered by a neighbor from the west and north, an alley from the east, and Street No. (192) from the south. The facade width of the disputed property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> is (16) meters, with a setback of (4.40 m), and the exterior cladding of the house is brown Sigma.
- The disputed property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> has (3) entrances with the following details:
  - Main entrance on the ground floor.
  - Side entrance leading to the basement.
  - Another side entrance leading to the kitchen and serving the two apartments on the second floor.
- The disputed property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> consists of: a basement, (3) floors, and a roof, with the following details:
  - The basement consists of a sunken courtyard, a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> with a bathroom, (1) hall, (1) room, (1) bathroom, and (2) storage rooms. There is also a driver's room with an isolated bathroom, accessible via the side entrance.
  - The ground floor consists of (1) hall, (1) master bedroom with a bathroom, a main kitchen, a dining room overlooking the hall, and (1) bathroom.
  - The first floor consists of a hall, a kitchen, (5) rooms, and (4) bathrooms, including (2) master bedrooms.
  - The second floor consists of (2) apartments, each containing (1) hall, (3) rooms, (2) bathrooms including (1) master bedroom, (1) kitchen, and a maid's room with a bathroom. The expert found that both apartments are occupied. The resident of apartment No. (1), Mr. Bader Al-Enezi <orig>بدر العنزي</orig>, stated that he has not paid rent since 2016 to date, but before 2016, he paid rent of K.D. (400). Mr. Abdul Mohsen Al-Ajmi <orig>عبد المحسن العجمي</orig>, resident of apartment No. (2), stated that he pays rent

and another room, meaning a total of 4 rooms, including a master bedroom.
c- The roof has a water heater room and a laundry corner.
d- The courtyard <orig>الحوش</orig> has an annex consisting of a room, a bathroom, and a laundry corner. The courtyard surrounds the building.
4- The finishes of the property include ceramic floors, decorative ceilings, aluminum and glass entrances, and external iron and glass entrances.
5- The exterior cladding is made of limestone painted light pink.
6- The air conditioning of the disputed property <orig>عين التداعي</orig> is central, and there is no electric elevator.

The representative of the defendant received a copy of the cover of the file. 9- The expert took photographs which will be included in the lawsuit file.

## Second: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall start at the base price of K.D. (300,000) (Three Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at his expense based on the price at which it was awarded to him in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

## Notice:
1- This announcement of sale shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in his favor at a fair market rent."

Vice President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> Sunday, 1 Rabi' al-Awwal 1447 AH - 2025/8/24 AD

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction

The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale of the property described below by public auction on Monday, 22/9/2025 AD, in Hall 5 - Eighth Floor - at the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> at 9:00 AM, in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 2021/556 Sales/1.
Filed by: Asma Ahmed Mohammed Al-Baloul <orig>أسماء احمد محمد البالول</orig>.
Against:
1- Nabil Abdullah Sulaiman Al-Sharhan <orig>نبيل عبدالله سليمان الشرهان</orig>.
2- Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> - Impleaded Defendant <orig>خصم مدخل</orig>.
3- Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> - Impleaded Defendant <orig>خصم مدخل</orig>.
Property Description: (According to the attached description certificate)
Property Document No. 7784/2000 located in Al-Qurain <orig>القرين</orig> area - Plot No. 84 - Block No. 4 - from Plan No. 36912/M, with an area of 400 m2, by public auction with a base price of (KD 310,000) three hundred and ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
** According to the description certificate:
- Violations in the property, which are:
  1- Construction on the ground and first floors without a license on the service road side.
  2- Construction of light materials on the roof without a license.
  3- Additional construction on the ground floor towards the service corridor.
** According to the expert's report:
On 12/8/2021, we, with the assistance of Mr. Expert / Faisal Al-Sharhan <orig>فيصل الشرهان</orig>, moved to Al-Qurain <orig>القرين</orig> area, Block 4, Street 5, House 42, in the presence and guidance of the first defendant (counter-claimant), while the remaining parties failed to attend, in preparation for estimating the value of the property subject of the lawsuit.
The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The property subject of the lawsuit is a government house conforming to the general and specific specifications of Document No. 2000/7784, with an area of 400m2.
- The property subject of the dispute is externally clad with Sigma <orig>سيجما</orig> and limestone, and the air conditioning system is central and split units.
- The property subject of the dispute is located on a secondary street and an alley, and is bordered by a neighbor on one side.

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction

The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale of the property described below by public auction on Wednesday, 17/9/2025 AD, in Hall 5 - Eighth Floor at the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> at 9:00 AM, in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 2023/594 Sales/2.
Filed by: Fadila Eid Saleh Ali <orig>فضيله عيد صالح علي</orig>.
Against:
1- Samir Abdullah Juma Al-Hawaj <orig>سمير عبدالله جمعه الحواج</orig>.
2- Director General of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> in his capacity.
Property Description: (According to the attached description certificate)
The property consists of a ground floor and a first floor. The property details are as follows:
- The ground floor consists of 2 living rooms + 2 bedrooms + 2 bathrooms + kitchen.
- The first floor consists of a living room + 4 bedrooms + 2 bathrooms.
- The courtyard has a room used as a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig>, and the roof has a maid's room and its bathroom.
- The expert found that the actual possessor of the property is the first defendant (counter-claimant) and his daughters.
Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at the base price, and participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by depositing the full auction price, in which case the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the bidder who made a deposit fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session, and no bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value.
The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

## Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:

1.  **First**: The auction shall commence at the basic price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
2.  **Second**: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
3.  **Third**: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
4.  **Fourth**: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
5.  **Fifth**: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense, based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by a deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
6.  **Sixth**: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, the expenses of enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
7.  **Seventh**: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
8.  **Eighth**: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

### Notice:

1.  This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2.  The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3.  The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "if the dispossessed owner resides in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

## Firstly: Property Description according to the attached Description Certificate:
Property of Document No. 1366 dated 13/2/2024 AD in Al-Qusoor <orig>القصور</orig> area, Block 7, Plot 446, with an area of 400 m², from Plan No. 37053 / Property Code 1999/11857001, Property Category: Private, Description: House. This will be sold by public auction with a base price of (432,000 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>) four hundred and thirty-two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

** As stated in the Description Certificate:**
Private residence consisting of a basement + ground floor + first floor + roof. There is a concrete violation on the ground floor at the rear of the property + protrusion + staircase on the ground floor facing the service road, and report no. 3613 was issued.

** And according to the expert's report**
On 28/12/2022, accompanied by Mr. Osama Al-Ruwaieh <orig>أسامة الرويح</orig>, the knowledgeable expert from the administration, we moved to Al-Qusoor <orig>القصور</orig> area - Block 7 - Street 34 - House 15, Plot 446, Automated Number (14669493), in the presence and guidance of the agent of the fourth plaintiff and the second defendant. The rest of the plaintiffs and defendants failed to attend. The inspection was carried out as follows:
The disputed property is a private residence of average construction, located on two streets (front and back). The property has a setback overlooking King Fahd Road <orig>طريق الملك فهد</orig> and has two neighbors.
The property consists of a ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a roof, clad in stone with central air conditioning and shutters for all doors and windows.
The property conforms to Document No. 11857 dated 28/8/1999 AD in terms of general and specific specifications and has an area of 400 m².
The basement consists of a hall + bathroom and washbasins + (2) rooms.
The ground floor consists of a hall + bathroom and washbasins + a room with an attached bathroom + kitchen + storage room.
The first floor consists of a hall + master bedroom with a bathroom and dressing room + (4) rooms + (2) bathrooms.
The second floor consists of a hall + (2) rooms + bathroom.
The roof is free of construction.
The second defendant stated that the occupants of the property are the first, second, and third defendants.
Mr. Expert Surveyor took all his observations of the property and stated that he would submit his report to estimate the market value of the disputed property.

# Public Authority for Investment / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma lil-Istithmar <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>
## Announcement of Practice No. M - 287/2025-2026
Purchase of Central Servers (Phase One)
The Public Authority for Investment / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma lil-Istithmar <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> announces the launch of the aforementioned practice. Specialized companies registered with the Public Authority for Investment are requested to refer to (Financial Affairs) (Public Authority for Investment Headquarters - Sharq - Block 1 - Street 201 - 21st Floor) to obtain the practice documents for a non-refundable fee of K.D. 75/- (only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars), payable by certified check. ## General Administration of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig>
### Customs Instructions No. 33 of 2025
Regarding the Restriction of the Increase of Customs Duties on Imports of Rebar and Iron Coils from (5% to 10%)
Director General of Customs <orig>مدير عام الجمارك</orig>:
Further to Customs Instructions No. (41 of 2024) regarding the increase of customs duties on imports of rebar and iron coils from (5% to 10%), and based on the letter from the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> No. (2025/858) dated 22/6/2025, registered under General Register Incoming No. 3464 dated 22/6/2024, concerning the decision of the Financial and Economic Cooperation Committee <orig>لجنة التعاون المالي والاقتصادي</orig> at its one hundred and twenty-third meeting held on Sunday, 1/6/2024, in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>, where the request to restrict the increase of customs duties on rebar (7214) and iron coils (7213) from (5% to 10%) for a period of one year from the date of approval of the Financial and Economic Cooperation Committee <orig>لجنة التعاون المالي والاقتصادي</orig> minutes was approved.
Accordingly, Directors are kindly requested to take note and instruct their specialists to implement the aforementioned decision of the Financial and Economic Cooperation Committee <orig>لجنة التعاون المالي والاقتصادي</orig>.
Issued on: 13 / 8 / 2025

## General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>

### Announcement

The General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> announces the offering of Practice (2025/2026/5) for the System Performance Monitoring System. Specialized traders in this field should refer to the Accounting Department (Cashier) at the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> in Mubarak Al-Abdullah Area <orig>منطقة مبارك العبدالله</orig>, Second Floor, to obtain the special specifications for a fee of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> – non-refundable, bringing with them the following documents: –
1- A copy of the Commercial Register.
2- A copy of the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> certificate.
3- A copy of the registration receipt with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
4- A copy of the fulfillment of the national labor percentage for non-governmental companies, issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig> and valid for one year with the bid.
5- Security deposit value: 2% of the practice bid value.
6- A copy of the supplier registration receipt with the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>.
7- A preliminary meeting on Sunday, 31/8/2025, at the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> main building.

**Item Two:** –
The attendance of the esteemed members of the Committee for the upcoming Committee meeting No. (2025/89) was recorded, and a legal quorum for its convening was confirmed.

**Item Three:** –
Opening of bids for Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig>: –
Bids were opened by the Bids Opening Committee <orig>لجنة فض العطاءات</orig> affiliated with the Supreme Purchasing Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء العليا</orig> at the headquarters of Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig>. The specific results for tenders and practices exceeding a value of (75,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) mentioned in the incoming report were reviewed. The Committee discussed this report and the bid opening schedules, then forwarded them to Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig> for study and submission of necessary recommendations within 30 days from this date. The Supreme Purchasing Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء العليا</orig> also instructed the Bids Opening Committee <orig>لجنة فض العطاءات</orig> to publish the report results immediately upon their approval by the Supreme Purchasing Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء العليا</orig>.

**Item Four:** –
Discussion of subscription request letters: –
Response to the subscription request submitted by Messrs. MOHAMMED ABDULMOHSIN AL-KHARAFI & SONS FOR GENERAL TRADING, GENERAL CONTRACTING regarding Tender No. (CB/CPC/2289) CONCRETE PAVEMENT AND INDUSTRIAL STRUCTURAL WORKS FOR MAB REFINERY.
The Committee reviewed the letter from Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig> dated 6/8/2025 regarding the above subject, and after discussion, the Committee decided to postpone the decision.

**Item Five:** –
Discussion of grievance letters: –
Consideration of the grievance letter submitted by Al-Khaleej Al-Lame' General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الخليج اللامع للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> regarding Practice No. (RFP-2126340) REPLACEMENT OF EXISTING VSD SYSTEM AND MAINTENANCE SERVICES AT WARA PMP.
The Committee reviewed the grievance letter submitted by Al-Khaleej Al-Lame' General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الخليج اللامع للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> dated 7/8/2025 regarding the above subject, and after discussion, the Committee decided to reject the grievance.

**Item Six:** –
Outgoing and Incoming Correspondence: –
Periodic Report on Work Assignment and Direct Contracting with Medium and Small Enterprises: (For Information)
The Committee was informed of the contents of the letter from the Central Qualification Committee <orig>لجنة التأهيل المركزية</orig> dated 7/8/2025 concerning the periodic report on work assignment and direct contracting with medium and small enterprises.

# KUWAIT OIL COMPANY (K. S. C.)
FOR ADVERTISEMENT

## PRE-QUALIFICATION EXERCISE (RE-ISSUANCE OF WORK CATEGORY KS 01.96)

Kuwait Oil Company (K.S.C.), the “Company”, is a State-owned entity engaged in exploration, development and production of crude oil and natural gas resources from Kuwait’s oilfields and exporting them through its marine terminals. The Company is inviting contractors interested in providing the following services to participate in this Pre-Qualification exercise:

RFI_17545
PQ#25/02: Re-Issuance of Work Category– KS 01.96
Provision of Medical Laboratory Tests

Interested applicants who wish to be considered for inclusion in KOC’s approved list of contractors for the above subject category are advised to download the Pre-Qualification documents from KPC & Subsidiaries K-Tendering Portal using the following sequence:
**HTTPS://KTENDERING.COM.KW> SUPPLIER ACCESS > MY RFIs > RFI_17545**

Applicants are advised to submit the applications at the earliest, no later than **25th September 2025**.

<table_caption>Application Requirements and Process</table_caption>
<table>
| Application Fees | Available Online for Download/Apply from | Eligible to Apply | How to Apply |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 150/- KD (for Local) (Non-Refundable) | 24th Aug. 2025 | Independent Local Contractors | Online on K-Tendering Portal Only (Hardcopy submissions shall Not be considered) |
</table>

Detailed instructions to the applicants are available in the General Terms & Conditions section of the PQ Application form. Kindly follow the instructions for the online submission.

**Note:**
1. Contractors included in the previous list shall also apply for this reissuance exercise. Only applicants successful in this exercise will be retained or included in the approved list.
2. All the submittal and its supporting documents must be in pdf file format only (except Financial Statement in excel format) and shall be properly segregated/numbered as per section and clauses.
For any further information/clarification, please write at email address: srm@kockw.com
